intro: Terminalia psidiifolia, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, followed by round, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ornamental contexts. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
